topics.body: Ever wondered why love hearts don't look like hearts at all? I mean, why can't during Valentines we all hang paper cuttings of round, squishy hearts instead of love hearts? And maybe give some chocolates in a human heart-shaped box? Or have human heart-shaped chocolates? Wouldn't that be more accurate?

"@Gizoid101":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/553c5d416368727161b91d00#post_553c5d416368727161b91d00
That ain't true.
If you teach a child from birth that this is how Valentines look, (s)he will think it looks normal. And then, you showed the usual heart-symbol, and (s)he would think it's stupid.

Life works in a funny way.
